pages.title: About These Blueprints
pages.text: $(br)These are pages copied from the side notebooks of T.M. Gearsprocketâ€”simple diagrams of small machines, annotated with cozy explanations. They're not to scale. They're not to code. But they turn just fine.

pages.title: Farm Diagram
pages.text: A simple rotating farm using harvesters and a mechanical bearing.

pages.title: Vertical Millstone
pages.text: A water wheel powered vertically into a millstone. Good for grinding wheat, seeds, or bone blocks. Place a chute or funnel beneath to catch the flour.

pages.title: Basic Press Setup
pages.text: Drop ingots on the depot. Power the press from behind or above. Smack it into sheets. Very satisfying. Do not stand under the press.

pages.title: Power Train Example
pages.text: Using cogwheels and a gearbox to transfer rotation in two directions. Useful when you need one machine spinning one way, and another the other.

pages.title: Chute & Funnel Chain
pages.text: Drop items down automatically through a chute into a a crate, chest or barrel. Good for sorting or timed drops.
